{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3499688,"name":"","username":"dan_frc","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/dan_frc/{size}/257062_2.png","created_at":"2025-02-02T02:56:26.028Z","cooked":"

Hello,

We’ve finished our robot drivebase.
But we cannot get it working wirelessly. I’ve set up the new radio, connected it to the robot and I get ROBORIO GOOD, and ROBOT RADIO GOOD, DS RADIO BAD, FMS BAD, on the driver station, but I don’t get any comms, meaning the the robot code and comms lights are red on the driver station. All goes well when I plug it in wired through a printer cable and our code works.

Code is likely not the issue, because I am able to enable the robot and drive around whilst connected wired. There are no warnings that are out of ordinary, just warnings about the joysticks etc

I’ve concluded that it may have sometime to do with the radio communicating with the rio.

I am able to ping the robo rio whilst connected to the radio.

I’ve tried to old radio and get the same problem.

Connecting to the radio via Ethernet also does not work. Similar issues occur

Whilst connected to the radio, Angry Ip scanner was ran. I was able to connect to the Orange Pi, the roborio, and all other things on that network.

Setup:
The robot code has its team number set.
The robo rio us been flashed and the correct team number is set
The radio has the correct team number set
The driver station has the correct team number

Has anyone ever had this issue?

Is the “Firewal” light red or green on the DS status tab? Do you have any firewall/anti-virus/etc software running on that laptop? Is the laptop managed by school/corporate IT?

Where do I find the firewall tab on DS?

dan_frc:

and I get ROBORIO GOOD, and ROBOT RADIO GOOD, DS RADIO BAD, FMS BAD, on the driver station,

This indicates that the DS software can reach the Robot Radio and the roboRIO.
DS RADIO BAD, FMS BAD is to be expected when you are not connected to a field.
